name: Document Title: ITP-CIV Rail Delineation Fencing
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep TALASILA
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Unless otherwise stated the following will apply: Concrete Mix is to be 25 MPa concrete per IFC drawings.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Supplier Certificate of Compliance
2.2 Steel components including posts, mesh and fittings
All Steel must comply with Australian Standards.
Steel section sizes must be checked on site.
Steel posts to be CHS with a grade of C250
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Survey to set out the following but not limited to: existing services, refuge bays and fence start and end points.
Offset checked against the running edge prior to installation of posts.
Follow asset owners guidelines for work around their service.
All post (fence and gate) foundations to be inspected by the site team prior to installing the posts. All foundations are to be free of water and loose material.
If the ground material on site does not meet the design assumptions, the Geotechnical Engineer shall be notified to determine if design change is required.

32 MPa concrete with min. 80mm cover when cast against ground. Concrete sampled as per Table 610.161 (1 sample taken for 0-10m3). Slump test to be performed for each sample, and three cylinders for testing of compressive strength taken for each sample.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP, Concrete Dockets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: DN80 MS Pipe (88.9 X 4CHS) to be installed with min. 80mm cover.
Chain-wire mesh 1800x50x2.50 to be fixed to fence post with cable ties in accordance with manufacturers specifications.
Chain shall be tightened and securely fastened to posts at max. 400 crs and tension wires at max. 500 intervals with 2.5 dia. galv. tire wire or clips.
Chain-wire mesh 1800x50x2.50 to be fixed to fence post with cable ties in accordance with manufacturers specifications.
Chain shall be tightened and securely fastened to posts at max. 400 crs and tension wires at max. 500 intervals with 2.5 dia. galv. tire wire or clips.
No chain wire mesh to be installed at refuge access.
Refuge Access to be located at max. 20m intervals along the fence.
Install additional refuge bays or reduced spacing to allow access to rail assets
50mm dia PVC pipe push out bars to be installed. PVC tubes to be pushed off from track side only.
Foundations and posts installed as above with 2400mm spacing.
2 no. 1800mm (H) x 2400mm (W) gate panels per gate.

Centre post of gate to be sleeved and positioned on the side external to the construction site to ensure gate only opens into construction site and gates that are parallel to track when closed open away from track.
Limited clearance signs to be erected at all refuge locations and at each end of Delineation Fence where fence is offset at 2.4m from the centreline of track.
Sign to read "DANGER LIMITED CLEARANCE DO NOT OCCUPY DURING PASSAGE OF TRAINS"
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Posts are to be checked for verticality and ensure offset is not less than required from near face of post to nearest rail.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Posts are to be checked for verticality and ensure spacings do not exceed standards.
Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance Final Inspection

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
